title: Graph Protection under Multiple Simultaneous Attacks: A Heuristic Approach
abstract: arXiv:2403.17108v1 Announce Type: new  Abstract: This work focuses on developing an effective meta-heuristic approach to protect against simultaneous attacks on nodes of a network modeled using a graph. Specifically, we focus on the $k$-strong Roman domination problem, a generalization of the well-known Roman domination problem on graphs. This general problem is about assigning integer weights to nodes that represent the number of field armies stationed at each node in order to satisfy the protection constraints while minimizing the total weights. These constraints concern the protection of a graph against any simultaneous attack consisting of $k \in \mathbb{N}$ nodes. An attack is considered repelled if each node labeled 0 can be defended by borrowing an army from one of its neighboring nodes, ensuring that the neighbor retains at least one army for self-defense. translated_title: 在多个同时攻击下对图的保护：一种启发式方法
translated_abstract: 这项工作旨在开发一种有效的元启发式方法，以防范对使用图模型的网络中的节点的多个同时攻击。具体来说，我们关注$k$-强罗马占领问题，这是对图上著名罗马占领问题的一般化。该问题是关于为节点分配整数权重，这些权重代表着每个节点驻扎的部队数量，以满足保护约束条件的同时最小化总权重。这些约束涉及对图对抗任何由$k \in \mathbb{N}$个节点组成的同时攻击的保护。如果可以通过从一个相邻节点借用军队来保护标记为0的每个节点，并确保该邻居至少保留一支军队进行自卫，则攻击被视为被击退。$k$-SRD问题在各个领域具有实际应用，例如制定反恐策略或管理...
tldr: 本研究开发了一种有效的元启发式方法来保护网络中节点免受多个同时攻击，特别关注$k$-强罗马占领问题，该问题在图中分配部队数量以最小化总权重以满足保护约束条件。
en_tdlr: This study developed an effective meta-heuristic approach to protect nodes in a network from multiple simultaneous attacks, focusing on the $k$-strong Roman domination problem where integer weights are assigned to minimize total weights while satisfying protection constraints.
